key_points: Tom Brady signed with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers on March 20, 2020.
The Buccaneers won the Super Bowl in their home stadium in February 2021.
Rumors of Brady's signing increased demand for season tickets even before the official announcement.
Due to the pandemic, Brady was introduced to Tampa Bay via a video conference call.
The Buccaneers introduced new uniform combinations inspired by their 2002 Super Bowl win.
Rob Gronkowski came out of retirement to join Brady at the Buccaneers.
Tampa Mayor Jane Castor announced Tom Brady was caught working out in a closed city park due to COVID-19 regulations.
Brady mistakenly entered a neighbor's house thinking it was the home of his offensive coordinator.
The Buccaneers lost six of their games between Week 1 and Week 12 but then won every game after their bye week.
Brady signed a one-year contract extension with the Buccaneers for the 2022 season.
spokespersons: Ed Glazer (Owner and CEO, Tampa Bay Buccaneers)
